Oludotun Akinola, Robert W. Bingler, David Cosca, Karen Dietz, Susan Gants, Nigel Kerr, Susan Munson, Daniel Pitti, David Seaman, Thornton Staples, John Unsworth, and Peter Yadlowsky.

titleStmt.title: Oxford, Corpus Christi College, Oxford, MS 201

publicationStmt.idno: Source copy consulted: Oxford, Corpus Christi College, Oxford, MS 201

head.note: This folio marker does not represent a leaf boundary at this point, but it is included to make it possible to display the facsimile image from this passus file.

lg.l: IF.3.1: The seven-line ornamental capital is red and green with flourishes in red to the top of the page. Covrbet Èyt on my knees / & gradde hire of grace.
& seyde mercy Madame / for Marie love of heuene.
Ãat bar Ã¾at blisful barn / Ã¾at bowhte vs on roode.F.3.3: A pointing hand appears in the right margin, added by a later hand.
& kenne me by sum craft / to knowe Ã¾e false.
Â¶ Loke on Ã¾y lyft half quod she ï ¡ & se where he standis.
BoÃ¾e Fals / & Favel / & here ferys manye.
Â¶ I lookede on my lyft half / as Ã¾e lady tawhte.
& was war of a womman / was worcheply clothyd.
& purfylyd with pelure / Ã¾e purest on erthe.
& crowned she was with a crowne / Ã¾e kyng haÃ¾ no bettre.F.3.10: F omits the following line from Bx: "Fetisliche hire fyngres were fretted with gold wyr."
& set abowhte with rubyes / as rede as ony gleede.
& with dyamaundes Ã¾e derrest / & doble dyuerse sapherys.
Oryentalis & ewagis / enemyes to distroye.
Â¶ Hire Robe was ful ryche / of reed skarlet greyned.
With Rubanes of reed gold / & ful of ryche stones.
Hire a-ray / me rauyschede / swich rycchesse seyÈ y neuere.
I hadde wondir what she was / & whoos wif she were.
Â¶ What womman ys Ã¾is / quod y ï ¡ so worthyly y-tyred.
She is Meede Ã¾e Mayde / quod she ï ¡ haÃ¾ noyed me ful ofte.
& often lakkyd my lemman / Ã¾at lewhte is y-hote.
& she is lowly to Lordis / Ã¾at lawys have to kepe.
& in Ã¾e popis paleyÈs she is / as priuy as my-selue.
Â¶ But Sothnesse wolde nono[t] so / for she bore bastard.F.3.23: Bx reads "for she is a Bastard." F's revision creates a T-type b-verse.
For fals was hire fadir / Ã¾at haÃ¾ a fykyl tunge.
& neuere soÃ¾ seyde / sytthe he com on erthe.
& Meede ys manered after hym / ryght as kynde askyÃ¾.

hi.hi:
ualis pater . talis filius . Iterum . Bonus arbor bonus
fructus habet . Malus arborF.3.27: The red ink has flaked or rubbed so that the <a> of the second arbor is illegible, only the top lobe remaining. malus fructus profert .

l.note: F.3.27: F alone expands the Latin tag. Bx ends after habet.

lg.l: Â¶ I awhte ben herrere Ã¾an she / y am of a bettre roote.
My Fadir grete god ys / grownde of alle gracis.
He is god with-owtyn gynnynge / & y am his goode dowhter.
& he gaf me mercy / to maryen with my-selue.
& what man be mercyful / & leelly me honowre.
Shal be my lord / & y his leef / in Ã¾e heyÈe hevene.
Â¶ & what man takÃ¾ meede / mynn heed dar y legge.
Ãat he shal leese . for hire love / his lappe ful of charyte.
See ï ¡ how dauid meneÃ¾ / of men / Ã¾at Meede taken.
& of men on Ã¾is Molde / Ã¾at MeyÈntene trowthe.
& how Èee shal save Èoure-selue / Ã¾e sawter Èow techeÃ¾.

hi.hi: omine quis habitabit in tabernaculo tuo . & cetera.

lg.l: / [Â¶] & now shal Meede be Maried / to a manshid shrewe.
To on fals & fykil of tunge / a foul feendis be-Èeete.
Favel Ã¾oruh his false speche / Ã¾is folk ys enchauntyd.F.3.42: Bx reads ". . . haÃ¾ Ã¾is folk enchaunted." Cf. 16.376b for the same formula.
& alle hise eyÈres eggynge / Ã¾at she shal be y-weddid.
& to-morwe worthÈ Ã¾e mariage / & Ã¾e Maydes brydale.
& Ã¾ere may Ã¾ou wete / if Ã¾ou wilt / wheche Ã¾ei ben alle.
Ãat longen to Ã¾at Lordchepe / Ã¾e lasse & Ã¾e more.
Knowe hem Ã¾ere / if Ã¾ou canst / & keep wel Ã¾yn tunge.
& lakke hem nowht but lete hem worÃ¾e / tyl Lewte be Iustise.
& have powher to punshe hem / & Ã¾an pyt furÃ¾ Ã¾y resoun.
Â¶ Now y be-kenne Ã¾e crist quod she / & his clene Moodir.
& Ã¾at no concyense a-cumbre Ã¾e / for coueytyse of meede.
/ [Â¶] Ãus lefte me Ã¾at Lady / lyggynge on slepe.
& how Meede was Maryed / in Meetelys me Ã¾owhte.
Ãat al Ã¾e alle Ã¾eal Ã¾e ryche retenew / Ã¾at regnede with sire false.
Weryn bodyn to his bydaleb[r]ydale / faire on boÃ¾e sydys.
Of alle manere of men / Ã¾e mene & Ã¾e ryche.
Â¶ To Marie Ã¾at mayde / wheryn men ensemblyd Ã¾ere.
Of knyghtys & of Clerkys / & oÃ¾ire comoun peple.
Of sysoures of sumnowres / & shereuys & here Clerkis.
Of Bedelis & Baylees / & brokores of Chaffare.
Forgowleres Forgoweres & vytaleris / & vocatis of Ã¾e archis.
& manye oÃ¾ir myster men / mo Ã¾an ben in myÈnde.F.3.62: This line appears only in F.
I can not redily rekne Ã¾e rowhte / Ã¾at ran a-bowhte Meede
/ [Â¶] But symony & Cyvile / & sysoures of courtys.
Where most priue with meede / of ony men Ã¾ere owte.
Â¶ But Favel was Ã¾e firste / Ã¾at fette hire out of chambre.
& as a brokour he browhte hire / to be with false en-Ioyned.
& whanne Symony & Cyuyle / seyen here boÃ¾e wille.
&F.3.69: Alpha is responsible for &. Beta manuscripts have Thei. assentide for syluer / to seyn / as boÃ¾e wolde.
/ [Â¶] Ãan leep LyÈere forÃ¾ / & seyde loo ï ¡ here a chartre.
Ãat Gyle with hise grete oÃ¾is / gaf hem to-gydre.
& prayede Cyvyle it to seen / & Symony yt redde.
Â¶ Ãanne Symony & Cyvile / stoden forÃ¾ bothe.F.3.73: F omits the following line from Bx: "And vnfoldeÃ¾ Ã¾e feffement that Fals hath ymaked."
& Ã¾us by-gunne Ã¾o goomes / to gredyn ful hyÈe.F.3.74: "IIIus" is written with red flourishes in the top right margin to mark the passus number.
Â¶ WeteÃ¾ wel & wytnessyÃ¾ / Ã¾at whonen vpon erthe.
Ãat Meede ys Maryed / more for hyre goodys.
Ãan for ony vertue / or fairnesse / or ony fre keende.
Falsnesse is fayn of hire / for he whot hire ryche.
& Favel with his fikyl speche / feffyÃ¾ hem by Ã¾ys chartre.
To been Princes of pride / & pouerte dyspyse.
To Bakbyte & boste wel / & toF.3.82: An otiose curl appears over the <t>. beryn fals witnesse.
To skoorne & to skoolde / & sklawndres to make.
& to be bold & vn-buxumF.3.84: Alpha is responsible for the word order "bold & vn-buxum." Beta witnesses read "vnbuxome and bolde." / to breke Ã¾e ten hestys.
To have Ã¾e Erldom of Envye / & wratthe to-gydres.
With Ã¾e Chastelet of Ieestys / & Ã¾e Iangelynge of synne.F.3.86: F's b-verse is unique. Beta manuscripts have "and chaterynge out of reson." R has "and chaterynge out of tyme."
& al Ã¾e Cuntres of Coueytise / with alle Ã¾e coostys abowhte.
Ãat is vserye & Avaryce / alle y hem grawnte.
In bargaynes & brokages / with Ã¾e bolde borghÈ of Ã¾efte.
& al Ã¾e Lordchepe of Leccherye / in LengÃ¾e & in brede.
In werkynge in wordis / in waytynge with yÈen.
In wenyngis / In wischyngis / & in wast Ã¾owhtys.
Ãere as wille wolde werke / ne were woo & drede.F.3.93: F's reading is unique. Bx reads "There as wil wolde and werkmanshipe fayleÃ¾."
He Èaf hem Glotonye eek / & grete oÃ¾is to-gydre.
& al day to drynke / ala[t] fele dyuerse tauernys.
& Ã¾ere to Iangle & to Iape / & Iuggyn here euyn-cristene.
& in fastyngeF.3.97: A kind of reversed virgule appearing here is probably a slip of the pen. dayes to frete / er ful tyme weere.

& softe syttyn & sowpe / tyl sleepF.3.98: An otiose mark appears above the final

. gyn hym a-sayle.
& broode hym as aF.3.99: The a is owed to alpha. borghÈ swyn / & bedde hym on a bolstre.
Tyl slewthe / & softe sleep / slyken hise sydes.
& Ã¾anne wanhope a-wake hym so / with no wil to a-mende hym.
For he be-leviÃ¾ to be loost / Ã¾at ys Ã¾e laste ende.
/ [Â¶] And Ã¾ey to haven & to holden / & alle here eyÈres after.
A derk dwellynge with Ã¾e deuyl / & be dampned for euere.
With alle pertynauncis of purgatorye / in-to Ã¾e pyne of helle.
For Ã¾is Ã¾yng Èeldynge / at on Èeerys ende.
Here sowlys to sathan / to suffre with hym peynes.
& with hym / to whone in woo / whilis god ys in hevene.
Â¶ In witnesse of Ã¾isF.3.109: The reading Ã¾is is owed to alpha. Beta reads which. Ã¾yng / wrong was Ã¾e firste.
& Pers Ã¾e Pardoner / of Pawlynes doctryne.
& Bette Ã¾e bedele / of Bokyngham-schyre.
& Reygnold Ã¾e Reve / of RokelondeF.3.112: The reading Rokelonde is owed to alpha. Beta reads Rutland. sokene.
& Munde Ã¾e Mellere / & manye mo oÃ¾ere.
In Ã¾e date of Ã¾e deuel / Ã¾is dede y a-seele.
By syght of sire Symony / & Cyvylys leve.
Â¶ Thanne was teenyd / theologye / whan he Ã¾is tale herde.
& seyde / to sire Cyvile / now sorwe mote Ã¾ou have.
Swiche weddyngges to wirche / to wratthe with trewÃ¾e.
& he Ã¾is weddynge haÃ¾ wrought / woo ï ¡ hym by-tyÈde.
For Meede ys Moylere / of a-Mendys ongendred[e]ngendred.
& god grauntid to gyve / Meede to trewthe.
& Ã¾ou hast gyve hire to a gylour / now god gyve Ã¾e sorwe.
Ãe tyxt tellyÃ¾ not so / trewÃ¾e whot Ã¾e soÃ¾e.
For dignus est operariuusoperarius / his heere to have.
& Ã¾ou hast fest hire with fals / fy ï ¡ on Ã¾yn lawe.
For al be lesyngys / Ã¾ou lyvyst ï ¡ & leccherouse werkys.
/ [Â¶] Ãan Symonye & Cyvyle / chydden holy chyrche.
& seide Ã¾e notarijs & Èee / foule noyÈhen Ã¾e peple.
Èee shulle a-begge it / boÃ¾e / by god Ã¾at me made.
Wel Èee wetyn wernardys / Ã¾at[but if] Èoure wit fayleÃ¾.
Ãat fals ys faythles / & fykil in hise werkys.
& asF.3.132: The reading as is owed to alpha. Beta reads was. a bastard y-bore / of Belzabubis kynne.
& Meede ys Moylere / & a Mayde of goode.
& myghte kyssen Ã¾e kyng / for kosyn & heF.3.134: Alpha preserves the he form for the third person singular feminine pronoun here. wolde.
For-Ã¾y ï ¡ wyrcheÃ¾ be wisdom / & be wit bothe.
& lediÃ¾ hire to Londoun / Ã¾ere lawhe ys y-shewyd.
If ony lawhe wille looke / Ã¾at Ã¾ey lyggyn to-gydres.
& Ã¾ey Iustyses Iuggyn hire / to be Ioyned with fasefa[l]se.
Èyt be war of Ã¾eF.3.139: The reading Ã¾e is owed to alpha, though it is shared by GH. Beta omits it. weddyngge / for wytty is trewthe.
& consience his conseylour / he knoweth Èow ecchone.
& if he fyÈnde Èow in defawhte / & with sire false holde.
He wil be-slotereF.3.142: MED s.v. bislotered, cites only one other instance of this verb, which appears as a variant in Chaucer, CT Prol. (CmbGg) A.76. Èoure sowlys / ful soure at Ã¾e laste.
F.3.143: A cropped red <x> appears in the left margin, a corrector's mark noting the error. Â¶ Herto asentyd Cyvyle / but Cyvyle[Symonye] ne wolde.
Tyl he hadde sum syluer / & alle hise notarijs.
F.3.145: A cropped red <x> appears in the left margin, possibly noting the failed alliteration in the preceding line. / [Â¶] Ãanne fette Favel forÃ¾ / floreynys y-nowe.
& bad Gyle goo gyve / gold al abowhte.
& namely to Ã¾e Notarijs / Ã¾at Ã¾ey noon fayle.
& feffe Fals / be witnesse / with floreynys y-nowe.
Ãat heF.3.149: The reading he is owed to alpha, though shared by L. Beta reads Ã¾ei. may Meede a-Maystrye / & makyn at myn wille.
Â¶ Whan Ã¾is gold was y-gyve / gret was Ã¾e Ã¾onkyng.
To fals / & to Favel / for here faire gyftys.
& kestyn a-wey care / & conforte sire false.F.3.152: The line is unique to F. Bx reads "And comen to conforten from care Ã¾e false."
& seyden sire for-soÃ¾e / seece shulle we neuere.
Tyl Meede be Ã¾y weddyd wif / Ã¾oru wyt of vs alle.
For we have Meede a-Maystried / Ã¾orghF.3.155: The reading Ã¾orgh is owed to alpha, though shared by H. Beta reads wiÃ¾. oure merye speche.
Ãat she graunteÃ¾ for to goo / with a good wille.
To lundenn to looken / if Ã¾at Ã¾e Lawe wille.

Iuggen it Iustelyche / in Ioye for euere.F.3.158: The following partially legible words were written in a secretary hand in the top margin: "he . . . / must no[t] in Redyng be to lyght." The top of the notation has been trimmed away.
/ [Â¶] Ãanne Fals was fayÈn / & Favel ful blythe.
& leet somoune alle men / in shyres a-bowte.
& bad hem alle been boun / beggeres & oÃ¾ere.
To wenden with hym to westmenstre / to witnesse Ã¾eF.3.162: The reading Ã¾e is owed to alpha. Beta reads Ã¾is. dede.
Â¶ But Ã¾an cared Ã¾ey for Caplis / to kayre hem to lundenn
& Favel fette furÃ¾ a-noon / fele folys sone.
& sette Meede on a Shereve / y-shood al newe.
& Fals sat on a Sysour / Ã¾at softly trottide.
& Favel on a Flatere / ful fetyÈsly a-tyred.
/ [Â¶] Ãan Notarijs hadde noone / & a-noyed Ã¾ey wheryn.
Ãat Symonye & Cyvile / sholde on foote rennyn.
Â¶ But Ã¾anne swoor Symonye / & Cyvile bothe.
Ãat Somnowres sholde be sadlid / & serue hem ecchone.
& propirly aparayle provysoures / in palfreyes wyse.
& sire Symonye hym-selue / shal syttyn on here bakkys.
& deenes & southdenes / let drawe to-gydre.
Archedeknys & officialis / & alle Èoure registrys.
& stoppe hem with syluer / oure synnes to suffre.
As devoos & devoutrye / & deerne vserye.
To bere Bisshopis a-bowte / a-brood to vysyte.
/ [Â¶] & Pawlynes peple / and pleyntis in Ã¾e constorye.
Shulle seruyn myn-selue / Ã¾at Cyvile is y-named.
& Cartesadle Ã¾e Commyssarye / oure carte shal he leede.
To fecche vs vytaylis / at fornicatores.
& Lyere shal be long carte / to leden alle Ã¾e oÃ¾ire.
As Fobberys / & Faytoures / Ã¾at on here feet renne.
Â¶ & Ã¾us fals & favel / faren forÃ¾ to-gydre.
& Meede in Ã¾e Myddys / & alle Ã¾e oÃ¾ire after.
I have no tome to telle / Ã¾e tail Ã¾at hem folweth.
Of many a manere man / Ã¾at on Ã¾e moolde lybbeÃ¾.
But Gyle was forgoere / & gyede hem alle.
/ [Â¶] Ãan Sothnesse seyÈ hem wel / & seyde but a lyte.
But prikede his palfray / & passede hem alle.
& cam to Ã¾e kyngys court / & consyence it tolde.
& Consyence to Ã¾e kyng / carped it after.
Â¶ Nou be crist quod Ã¾e kyng / & y cacche myghte.
Fals eyÃ¾irF.3.195: The reading eyÃ¾ir is owed to alpha. Beta has synonymous or. Favel / or feerys of hise felachepe.
I wolde be wrooke of Ã¾o wrecchis / Ã¾at werche so Ille.
& don hem hongyn be Ã¾e hals / & alle Ã¾at hem meyghtenmey[n]ten[e].
Sholde neuere man on moolde / menprise Ã¾e leeste.
But ryght as Ã¾e Lawe wille / lete falle on hem alle.
/ [Â¶] Anon he comoundidcom[a]undid a constable / to comen at Ã¾e fyrste.

F.3.201: The scribe in his rubricating mode wrote what appears to be an <l> surrounded with marks rather like modern commas in the top margin immediately above the ampersand.& gooF.3.201: The reading goo may be unique in F. The margin of R is badly cropped and the beginning of the line lost, but oo appears. Beta reads To. tache Ã¾o tyrawntys / for ony thyng y hote.
& fetre faste False / For ony faire gyftys.
& loke Ã¾ou gerde of Gyles heed / & let hym go no furthere.
& if Ã¾ou lacche LyÈere / lete hym nowht a-skape.
Er he be pyt on Pillory / for ony prayere y hoote.
& loke Ã¾ou brynge Meede to me / Mawgre hem alle.
Â¶ Ãan stood drede at Ã¾e dore / & al Ã¾e dome herde.
& how Ã¾e kyng comaundide / constablis & sergauntys.
Ãat False / & his felachepe / to fetere & to byÈnde.
Â¶ Ãanne Dreede wente wyÈhtly / & warnede False.
& bad hym flee for ferd / & hise feerys alle.
Â¶ & a-non Fals for feere / fleyÈ streyt to Ã¾e Frerys.
& with hym Gyle gan goo / for gast he sholde dyÈe.
But Marchawntys mette with hym / & made hym abyÈde.
& settyn hym in here shoppis / to shewen here ware.
& paraylid hym lyÈk a prentyÈs / Ã¾e peple to serue.
Â¶ Ful lyghtly Lyere / leep a-wey Ã¾enne.
Lurkende Ã¾orghÈ lanes / to-luggyd of manye.
He was no-wher wolkome / for hise manye talys.
But oueral hyÈe howted / & y-hoote to trusse.
& Pardoneris hadden pyte / & pullyd hym to howse.
& wasshed hym / & wyped hym / & wounnde hym in cloÃ¾is.
& sentyn hym with seelys / on sundayes to chirchis.
& gaf pardoun for pens / pownd-meel a-bowte.
Â¶ Ãanne Lowrede Lechis / & Lettrys Ã¾ey sentyn.
Ãat he wolde wone with hem / watrys to looke.
Â¶ Fele spyceris spoke toF.3.227: The reading to is owed to alpha. Beta reads with. hym / to a-spyÈe here ware.
For he cowhde onF.3.228: The reading on is owed to alpha, though appearing also in Hm and Hm2. Beta reads of. here craft / & knew fele gummes.
Â¶ Ãanne Menstralis & Messagerys / mettyn with hym o weye.
& heelde hym half aF.3.230: The reading half a is owed to alpha, though shared by CrH. Beta reads an half. Èeer / & elevene dayes.
Â¶ But Freris with Fair speche / fecchid hym Ã¾enne.
& for komynge knowerys / Ã¾ey copid hym as a Frere.
But haÃ¾ leve / to leepen owt / as oftyn as hym lykeÃ¾.
& ys wolkome . whan he wille / with-owtyn ony daunnger.F.3.234: The b-verse is unique to F. Bx reads "and woneÃ¾ with hem ofte."
Â¶ & alle Ã¾e oÃ¾ire fledde for feer / & faste flown to hyrnes.
Save Meede Ã¾e Mayde / no moo durste a-byde.
But trewÃ¾e to telle / she tremblede for feere.F.3.237: The reading feere is owed to alpha. Beta reads drede.
& alsoF.3.238: The reading also is owed to alpha. Beta reads ek. wepte & weylede / for she was a-tachid.
